title: adultcrypto
author: adultcrypto
content: The terms and conditions of casinos and other companies is usually very lengthy and somehow boring for some people. Hence , many people rarely find time to read them. They may actually contain some of the complaints that people raise about some casinos such requiring KYC if there is need or suspicion of money laundering activities. What is your take on this?

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: If you have taken your time to read the terms of service of a casino or other gambling sites before, reading another gambling site terms of service will just be like you are glancing through it. I do not take time to read much anymore. I prefer to read the important part which are:1. KYC requirement needed or not2. Restricted countries3. Deposit and withdrawalAfter checking those, I will later find time to read the ToS in full anytime that I am less busy, but when I am already using the site.

comments.author: Stepstowealth
comments.body: If casinos will make their terms and conditions more shorter and readable, a lot more gamblers will take the time to read through what the casino says. The problem with term and conditions is that asides the fact that they can be long and boring, the font used for the writing of theses terms is not always attractive to read, hence many gamblers do not waste time there, but will quickly accept the terms and conditions even without reading. Some other gamblers also assume that the terms and conditions of all casinos are the same, so because they have read the T and C for this casino, they do not read the  conditions by the other casino.

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: Sincerely speaking the lengthy part of most casinos are very tiring I tried create an account in a local gambling site but when I tried to advance the site the more I keep reading lots of compliance and it's nothing but just kyc and the rest just as above poster just explained. Even though I am still new to the gambling side I make sure to pass kyc before making deposit to start placing bet though I still finds it very difficult to go about with how the game selection process yet I don't give hope usually we need patient to read those terms and conditions and if we do I don't see ourselves running into trouble with those casinos and believe me or not most common issues won't arise for any reason except it's not properly followed. But important things oshosondy has outlined them all.

comments.author: mvdheuvel1983
comments.body: Not always. Since the choice to play ta a casino is mostly inspired by friends, I don't really it. I just my friends judgement. The only time I have read their terms and conditions is when I had help.uness I have problems with maybe deposits, withdrawal, KyC,, then I read it Because of it's bulkiness most of us ignore it. There should be a summarize or consized version of it highlighted in bullet points.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: For the two casinos that I am using, I read their terms and policies; they were actually lengthy, but it is very important to know those terms so that the gambler will not do what will complicate their account, and just like Oshosondy has said, there is not too much difference in the TOs of  casino.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on December 15, 2023, 11:21:39 PMI prefer to read the important part which are:1. KYC requirement needed or not2. Restricted countries3. Deposit and withdrawalThe same thing here, i'll just ctrl+f these things before or sometimes after registering. But before doing that, a little google for reviews first. If it's just new well, take risks to browse but will not use yet. But most of the time this forum is my standard way of researching, casinos that has ann thread here with enough positive thoughts and experienced from others will always be to-go casinos.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Quote from: Stepstowealth on December 15, 2023, 11:24:40 PMIf casinos will make their terms and conditions more shorter and readable, a lot more gamblers will take the time to read through what the casino says. The problem with term and conditions is that asides the fact that they can be long and boring, the font used for the writing of theses terms is not always attractive to read, hence many gamblers do not waste time there, but will quickly accept the terms and conditions even without reading. The terms and conditions of the sites that I have know before is not boring and have good font.It is the old casinos that do have longer terms of service. New casinos terms of service are not that long. I do not see it long generally because I only read the important parts, not all.Quote from: Stepstowealth on December 15, 2023, 11:24:40 PMSome other gamblers also assume that the terms and conditions of all casinos are the same, so because they have read the T and C for this casino, they do not read the  conditions by the other casino.It is good to still check the important information. Some gamblers may later be banned but found out it is because he did not read the terms and conditions.

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: To be honest, I have never read the entire TOS of any casino or website I use, this is because there is so much written in the TOS that I get tired and lazy to read everything, so I look for the things that I see to be most important at that moment, things like list of restricted countries, deposit and withdrawal conditions (wagering requirements) and whether or not you have kyc and then I focus on finding out more about the bonus, although I'm not interested in the sign-up bonus, I still care about read about him in the TOS because he has been the center of many fights and as I am afraid of depositing money in a casino and then not being able to withdraw it so I prefer to know everything about it.Now there are questions such as the casino validating or not validating a winner, a game or a bet and in the casino books this part is too long to read, it's a headache, although it will actually be a very important part, I prefer not to read it, when I see that I've seen enough in the tos and I'm happy to create an account at the casino, but there are times when I don't read anything in the tos. I create an account and I will only read it when I want to make a deposit. As I already got it in my head that all casinos will ask for kyc so I already know that I will have to do kyc so in that part I'm not surprised. casinos should create a simpler format with less things for us to read. It's very tiring to read a lot of things

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: adultcrypto on December 15, 2023, 11:16:46 PMThe terms and conditions of casinos and other companies is usually very lengthy and somehow boring for some people. Hence , many people rarely find time to read them. They may actually contain some of the complaints that people raise about some casinos such requiring KYC if there is need or suspicion of money laundering activities. What is your take on this? If you're serious about playing in a casino the word boring should not be in your vocabulary when reading the TOS of each casino that you're going to be active, not reading will put you at risk in the future, I have seen so many gamblers not paying attention and they pay the price that is they cannot withdraw the money that they have won, pay attention to TOS and make sure that if there are chances you are fully aware of the changes.KYC is part of casinos compliance if you're not comfortable with that you will have to find casinos that do not implement this, that's if you can find one that has all the features and reputation of top casinos with KYC.It either you do or you don't because you don't have choices.

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: I actually spend time reading on bitcointalk and try to search if there have been any accusations and if they happened to be at all credible if they had a good resolution. Bitcointalk as a public forum is very good at showcasing a platform's noteworthyness and trust. So as an old forum, I tend to trust it as a staple for anything related to gambling.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: While it is indeed the responsibility of the player to completely read the terms and conditions of the casinos before agreeing and signing up, I doubt if gamblers actually practice this. I've been gambling for quite a while already and I think I haven't fully read a casino or betting site's terms and conditions. At most, I've read sections. Many times, I've checked on the terms and conditions only after signing up and playing. In other words, I've lied when I ticked on those boxes saying I've read and understand and agree with the terms and conditions. Perhaps everybody does.

comments.author: ralle14
comments.body: I also do the same and quickly scroll over it because the only crucial parts for me are the KYC, country restrictions, and the limits between non-verified accounts.If the terms and conditions aren't clear enough, i'll sometimes contact their support to clarify certain parts.Quote from: mvdheuvel1983 on December 15, 2023, 11:36:08 PMThere should be a summarize or consized version of it highlighted in bullet points.At least the FAQ or help section becomes the alternative for that.

comments.author: Fundamentals Of
comments.body: To be fair I think not everything in the terms and conditions are very important that we have to read all of them before creating an account. You can actually jump straight to your most important details such as whether you're allowed to play there from where you're living. Or if you're very particular about any possibility that you'll be asked to provide personal information, you can go ahead and look for the specific items pertaining to the gathering or keeping of those information.

comments.author: tsaroz
comments.body: Quote from: adultcrypto on December 15, 2023, 11:16:46 PMThe terms and conditions of casinos and other companies is usually very lengthy and somehow boring for some people. Hence , many people rarely find time to read them. They may actually contain some of the complaints that people raise about some casinos such requiring KYC if there is need or suspicion of money laundering activities. What is your take on this? I don't think anyone really do. And as I'm not into money laundering or mixing I don't think any of it matters. I haven't ever used a VPN on gambling site.And as I gamble with smaller amount, I have never faced any event for my funds being held by casino. I also don't remember filling a KYC on crypto based casino. Did it on bet365 and might not be unwilling to do that if I have to.Whatever the terms maybe, there's practically no use of it as they can change it anytime. The best way to avoid the casinos you don't want to join is to go through their review.

comments.author: len01
comments.body: sometimes I read but sometimes I dont but it depends on the situation what I want to do, I mean when I want to register at a new casino usually the main thing I read is about the minimum or maximum deposit and withdrawal amount and after that about the KYC rules.for me, the most important point is just what I mentioned, even though there is a lot in the ToS, problems usually occur with KYC and withdrawals or deposits.for other people here who have experience, of course they will also do the same thing as me because it really takes a long time to read the entire contents of the ToS, so those who are here only read what is most needed and to be honest, I myself very rarely use new sites because more often on favorite sites, every time there is a ToS change, there is always a notification when I log in.but it's a good idea if you have a lot of free time, it would be better to read the entire contents of the ToS so that no mistakes occur and break the rules accidentally and some people who complain in the scam section about their reputation usually also have mistakes such as breaking the ToS rules by reason of not reading them.

comments.author: Rabata
comments.body: People who gamble on online platforms usually do not try to follow the mentioned terms and conditions. The biggest reason for this is that the rules and regulations are written in legal jargon which is not easy for everyone to understand. Moreover, the terms and conditions are written in a large size in words that it becomes a matter of long time to find the desire terms. Gamblers feel that those who have started this casino business must be doing it from their good thoughts and must try to give their maximum. Moreover, since there is a lot of competition among gambling platforms, they must provide good service. Gamblers have positive thoughts and avoid reading those terms and conditions easily. But the gambler must have a good idea in several important factors like deposit, withdrawal or KYC verification.

comments.author: Helena Yu
comments.body: Yes, but only focus about the information you're looking for. Let's say you don't have any problem with KYC, then there's no need to check the casino has a mandatory KYC or not. But you're in Russia, since you know many sites had sanctions Russian citizens to use their sites, you need to check whenever Russia is restricted or not in their site.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: Quote from: adultcrypto on December 15, 2023, 11:16:46 PMThe terms and conditions of casinos and other companies is usually very lengthy and somehow boring for some people. Hence , many people rarely find time to read them. They may actually contain some of the complaints that people raise about some casinos such requiring KYC if there is need or suspicion of money laundering activities. What is your take on this? Do people really read those?Not just from the signing up in casinos but in almost every website and services that we use, I think that only a very few people does that time on reading all of those.Like in a million people, only handful of them probably are or there's no one that does finish the reading with what's written into those.

comments.author: irhact
comments.body: Quote from: adultcrypto on December 15, 2023, 11:16:46 PMThe terms and conditions of casinos and other companies is usually very lengthy and somehow boring for some people. Hence , many people rarely find time to read them. They may actually contain some of the complaints that people raise about some casinos such requiring KYC if there is need or suspicion of money laundering activities. What is your take on this? Reading of terms and conditions of any platform is important, we don't have a culture of doing that but just click accept and start using the platform without knowing what is written and later we begin to complain when things written as those terms and condition are been done. You won't waste more than 10 minutes reading the terms and conditions of casino platform therefore it's better we read them so we know what we're signing up to. If the case was to go to a law court, they can use the fact that you accepted their terms and condition against you and you lose the case. Casino that won't to scam their customers will put in terms that will favour them when they want to denied you access to your winnings due to lack of kyc or been unable to convincingly proof the source of your capital that you used for gambling for people that used a large sum and also won a large amount of money.
